project.teaser: The SYMBIO project provides European regional communities with tools and methodological approaches to building bio-based business models based on circularity by-design and industrial symbiosis.Thanks to tools for integrating big data and artificial intelligence, SYMBIO shapes...
project.objective: The SYMBIO project provides European regional communities with tools and methodological approaches to building bio-based business models based on circularity by-design and industrial symbiosis. Thanks to tools for integrating big data and artificial intelligence, SYMBIO shapes 10 symbiotic business models with high-profitability sustainability replicable at the EU level to increase bio-based products on the market and provides a system to modelling, measure and monitor symbiosis and its social, economic and environmental impacts. SYMBIO methodology will be designed, tested and validated in 12 EU pilot regions (Lombardy, Piedmont, Veneto, Friuli-Venezia Giulia, Emilia-Romagna, Carinthia, Slovenia, Croatia, Andalusia, Bruxelles Capital, Wallonia, Flanders) that have been selected based on the estimation of their bio-based resources defined by raw material availability, socio-economic indicators, intangible networks and infrastructures and potential for development of CBE close-to-market supply chains and current trends. Involving all supply chain actors in a quadruplex approach will help unlock and stimulate local development potential by promoting sustainable, innovative, tangible and participatory pathways to the green transition through an inclusive bottom-up CBE nexus.
project.title: Shaping symbiosis in bio-based industrial ecosystems based on circular by-design supply chains
project.keywords: industrial symbiosis, biobased industries, value chains, artificial intelligence

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SYMBIO (Shaping symbiosis in bio-based industrial ecosystems based on circular by-design supply chains)
result.teaser: SYMBIO addresses the urgent need to accelerate Europe’s transition towards a sustainable circular bioeconomy.SYMBIO’s overall objective is to design and implement a methodology for shaping symbiotic bio-based industrial ecosystems across twelve European pilot regions. By...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Regional Hub handbook for data collection and harmonization
result.description: Desk research to identify actors and interrelationships of initiatives in existing networks supporting industrial symbiosis. The mapping includes the definition of classification criteria for INPUT (biomass, plants, technologies), PROCESSES and OUTPUT (applications, finished products, markets) of biobased products adapted to industrial sectors characterized according to the NACE classification system. The inventory is based on the systematization of data collected from various sources, such as data hubs of funded projects, studies (e.g. publications or scientific results) and existing EU platforms (e.g. H4C by ECoP).

result.title: Report on regional stakeholder ad cross-fertilization meetings
result.description: Regional stakeholder communities (Italy, Slovenia, Andalusia, Carinthia, Croatia, Belgium) are created to invite relevant regional stakeholders (primary producers, biomass harvesters, converters, consumer goods producers, universities, policy makers) in a 2 days to facilitate their dialogue to identify barriers and critical factors enabling industrial symbiosis, AI-based methods/tools to create business opportunities, biomass and resource selection criteria.In addition, a half-day online meeting, open to all members of the regional community, during which the Regional Data Hub and the summary map of its contents are shared and discussed.

result.title: Companies/Clusters mapping and VCG.AI enhancing
result.description: Intending to develop a methodology to measure the acceleration of value chains from TRL 5 to TRL 9 that can be universally used and replicated in a scalable manner, two models to describe industry players and regional clusters/enterprise networks of 12 regions pilot is created.

result.title: Regional Data-Hub inventory and data map
result.description: A comparative assessment of regional biomass availability, business models, technologies and knowledge enables the understanding of symbiosis industrial enablers and their prioritization. The work is based on the following activities: (i) assessment of the regional availability of bio-based raw materials, (ii) assessment of business models, (iii) data harmonization and matching, (iv) trigger dynamics for industrial symbiosis.

result.title: Support activities for empowering clusters and industrial ecosystems in circular value chains design
result.description: Tailored mentoring, coaching and training services to regional networks of clusters/enterprises are developed to support modeling of circular by-design value chains and strengthen support services to their members. Coaching services are provided through online channels (including specific webinars for target groups, online meetings, etc.) and workshops (online/onsite/hybrid).

result.title: Policy overview and recommendations – Preliminary version
result.description: Our analysis at the EU level will focus on identifying the primary impediments and facilitators that arise from current and forthcoming regulations. Specifically, we will examine relevant European Green Deal strategies, including their action plans, directives and regulations that will be amended or developed as part of this initiative. We will also assess the bioeconomy strategy and associated regulatory actions. In addition, we will investigate the connections between these initiatives and other EU policy proposals, measures, and macro-regional-level fragmentation of responsibilities that affect resource transfer and end-of-waste criteria.

result.title: Continuously updated Dissemination and communication plan (CDP) and first draft of the Exploitation Strateegy Plan (ESP)
result.description: A coherent and well-targeted Communication and Dissemination Plan (CDP) will be developed during the first months and regularly updated. It will provide communication and dissemination strategies and guidelines for best practices to be performed during the project's life and actions that will continue to promote the project results after the end of the project. Furthermore, the CDP will define the objectives, the target audience and users, the tools and channels, and the metrics to measure the impact. It will provide a recognisable identity for the project. The plan also describes the internal communication procedures guided by LGCA

result.title: Inventory and characterization of 50 BioLinks
result.description: VCG.AI is used to model Circular Value Chain (BioLink) solutions, matching the types of farms, material and waste streams, and processing technologies available regionally for each of the 12 pilot regions.Around 50 possible circular connections between industry players in the 12 pilot regions will be defined, representing the potential to link material and waste sub-flows between companies from different sectors to build circular value chains.

result.title: Continuously updated Dissemination and communication plan (CDP) – Mid-term version
result.description: A medium-term update of the Communication and Dissemination Plan (CDP) illustrates the communication strategies, the guidelines developed and the communication tools implemented in the RP1. Relevant KPIs will be described to monitor the effectiveness of the communication strategy, also providing guidelines to be applied in RP2.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
